title: Were there black Caucasians (Caucasoids) in Ancient Greece? - Quora

response.answer_text: Caucasians are people living in areas surrounding the Caucasus Mountains. They were not black. Greeks like ALL Europeans, originated from the same ancient ancestors. Early hunter - gatherers, the Anatolian Farmers 8000 years ago and the Indo-Europeans. Ancient hunter - gatherer woman’s remains found in Greece, dated 9000 years and recreated:  7500 year old Neolithic woman who was 90% Anatolian and 10% Mesolithic European found in Gibraltar and recreated. These ancient farmers from Anatolia who migrated Europe and Greece, resembled this woman and modern Southern Europeans and Greeks still resemble her:  Greek mosaics during the classical era:   The same people have always lived in Greece. Modern Greeks looking like all their ancient ancestors carrying the same DNA:

The reason I asked this question is because I've been reading alot of comments about North Africa saying that region always had White Hamites in it. If there is a such thing, then there had to been some black caucasoids. Just a question.
